reviewText: This is a very good product, well made with excellent technical quality.  The poses are good, the nudity is generous, although more closeups would've been good along with more intimate poses.  You will like this edition in your collection.
summary: A welcome addition to any collection.

reviewText: "Yoga Undressed" is a series of videos - Beginner, Intermediate, Advanced, and the Duet - where the performers demonstrate Yoga moves . . well, undressed.  The routines are tastefully done.  There's a light New Age, Middle Eastern sound track in the background.  The setting is a large room lit by candles.  And the women exercise on colorful mats atop a light colored hard wood floor.  The mood is very relaxed.This is the Beginner episode.  It features a very attractive and feminine artist with tight ringlet curls, which are even tighter - you-know-where.  She isn't totally clean-shaven as a little tuft saves just a bit of her for our imagination just as nature intended.  There is a fair amount of frontal nudity in this video.  But the intent is more aesthetic and sensual rather than trying to be erotic.  In this regard, the video is mainly successful.  Too bad.I guess Yoga is a form of exercise that allows one to stretch and strengthen your muscles - from a virtually stationary position.  You can do it indoors in a room much smaller than the one used for this release.  Yoga is also good for improving  muscle tone, breathing, circulation and one's posture and also for promoting relaxation and relieving stress.  Gee, all that?The movie takes us through - all of the exercises in a sort of unbroken routine - which is very entertaining to watch.  It then provides additional chapter breaks - so that you can work on each individual pattern separately -- which is a feature I really liked.As an aerobic endeavor, Yoga probably isn't as good as, say other more equipment-based forms of indoor activity - such as walking, jogging, riding a stationary bike or stair climbing.  But it probably works a broader array of muscle groups.  And it also strengthens, as this movie subtly points out those muscles that are widely used for sex.  Try doing that on your elliptical machine.The narrator even highlights this - during exercises that test the abdominals and the inner core - or for leg lifts done with limbs both together and apart.  Or maybe I'm just focused in that direction - given that the demonstrator is distractingly nude.If you're looking for either a Yoga or exercise video - that is visually a cut above -- then "Yoga Undressed, the Goddess" is a series that I would highly recommend.  Enjoy.FYI, other titles in the series:Yoga Undressed, The Goddess Series - Naked Yoga for the Intermediate: A Flowing Tantric Vinyasa, Kundalini & Hatha Yoga PracticeYoga Undressed, The Goddess Series - Naked Yoga for the Advanced: A Flowing Tantric Vinyasa, Kundalini & Hatha Yoga PracticeYoga Undressed, The Goddess Series - Naked Yoga The Duet : A Visual Exploration of Tandem Flowing Tantric Vinyasa, Kundalini & Hatha Yoga Practice
Title: N/A

reviewText: For anyone who loves the practice of Yoga in the nude, this is a good DVD, however the model on the cover isn't on the DVD, which is disappointing & misleading seeing that she is on the back cover as well, a different model is shown on the DVD, not that there is anything wrong with her, but this cover model is the one I wanted to see.....if they are not on the DVD, don't put them on the cover!....all in all this is still a keeper.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love the production values of this video.  The cinematography was nothing less than stupendous. The artistic way in which the film makers presented the female body left me amazed and grateful.  I was in this ulta-heightened state of oneness with Gaia the Nature Goddess when I suddenly lost interest and felt the overwhelming need to switch over to Comedy Central and watch an episode of Southpark.
Title: N/A
